q: According to a report by BBC News, Craig Oliver , who will be employed by the government as a special advisor, was approached late last week by Andy Coulson and will receive a salary of? 140,000. I'm delighted to be joining David Cameron and his team at such an exciting and challenging time, he said in a statement.`` It's difficult to leave the BBC after a fascinating few years- but this is an opportunity I can't turn down.'' of its top management on Thursday, announcing that co-founder Larry Page would replace Eric Schmidt as chief executive of the Internet giant in April. Google said Eric Schmidt would remain with the company as executive chairman, focusing on deals, partnerships, customers and broader business relationships. He would act as an adviser to Larry Page and Google's other co-founder, Sergey Brin , who would work on strategic projects and new products. The management changes were due to take effect on April

Bernie Sanders Welch to get the appropriate waivers and flexibility for us to go forward toward a single-payer system.'' Welch said, When Vermont innovates, the nation often follows our lead. Providing Vermont and other states with the flexibility to build upon health care reform will result in better care and greater access at a lower cost. Allowing us to become a laboratory for innovation and excellence will help Vermonters, while once again allowing us to lead the way. Patrick Leahy said,`` While some in Washington are trying to turn the clock back on health reform, Vermont instead is moving forward.
